definition: to handle administrative work
to simplify matters/to save trouble
to inspect/to examine/to be aware/to pay a visit (to one's parents or elders)
to save/to economize/to do without/to omit/to leave out/province/(archaic) central government department
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]

sentences.english: I’ve always tried to stay out of trouble so they never have to.
sentences.chinese: 我也一直試着不去惹是生非，所以他們也省事了。

sentences.english: Choose the more easy way of food, such as chicken bones to eat better than the Chicken.
sentences.chinese: 選擇較省事的食物，如喫帶骨的雞肉比雞丁好。

sentences.english: Excellent quality, perfect service, allows you to save money worry .
sentences.chinese: 過硬的質量，完善的服務，讓您省錢省心省事。

sentences.english: Some even put themselves at risk taking short cuts by climbing dividers in the middle of roads.
sentences.chinese: 還有些人爲了省事甚至冒險翻越路中間的防護欄。

sentences.english: Microwave dinners and instant foods make cooking at home a snap.
sentences.chinese: 微波爐晚餐和實時餐點使得在家燒飯省事又快速。

sentences.english: To keep things simple, the game doesn't have features common elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 爲了省事，這款遊戲缺少了其他遊戲中的常見元素。

definition: troublesome/to take a lot of trouble to do sth
to save labor/to save effort
to cause no trouble/to be spared worry/worry-free
to save labor/to save effort
to omit/to dispense with/to make unnecesary/to save (time, trouble etc)
to save money
need not
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to spend a great deal of time and effort/(of a task) demanding/exacting
it isn't worth it/not cost-effective/not profitable/too expensive
to expend a great deal of effort
to require effort/strenuous
worthwhile/to be a good deal/to be a bargain/to reckon up/to calculate
to do (sth) oneself/to help oneself to
to avoid/so as to save (money or time)
erhua variant of 費勁|费劲[fei4 jin4]
